forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow likely before 1pm, then snow likely and patchy fog. Cloudy, with a high near 36. South wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow and patchy fog before 7pm, then patchy fog and rain and snow between 7pm and 1am, then patchy fog and a slight chance of snow between 1am and 3am, then a slight chance of freezing rain between 3am and 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 30. Southwest wind 3 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The morning in Boston greets us with a thick veil of fog, cloaking the surroundings in a muted gray. Snow flurries are anticipated, swirling gently before noon, adding a whisper of winter's chill to the already damp atmosphere. As the day stretches on, the skies will remain overcast, with a high of about 36 degrees. The faint echo of a southern breeze gives a slight warmth to the air, but the presence of cloud cover and a hefty chance of precipitation renders any outdoor plans a touch precarious. 

As evening approaches, expect a continuation of the wintry mix. Patchy fog will embrace the city, possibly playing a gentle game with rain and snow, only to hint at a slight chance of freezing rain in the early morning hours. With temperatures dipping to around 30, warmth will be essential. Layering becomes a necessity—donning a cozy sweater under a waterproof jacket, along with sturdy boots to navigate the slush. The day may not offer the most inviting conditions for sauntering outdoors, but perhaps a quiet afternoon at a local café, sipping warm beverages and indulging in a good book, could be the perfect remedy to counter the dreariness of the weather.
